info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McDowell, south central Caldwell and southwestern Burke Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 437 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Marion, or near Lake James State Park, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morganton, Valdese, Drexel, Glen Alpine, Lake James State Park, South Mountains State Park, Lake James, Gamewell, Lake Rhodhiss and Nebo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
